es.csic.iiia.bms.factors
Class AbstractTwoSidedFactor<T>

java.lang.Object
  es.csic.iiia.bms.factors.AbstractFactor<T>
      es.csic.iiia.bms.factors.AbstractTwoSidedFactor<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of the factor's identity.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Factor<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
TwoSidedEqualityFactor, TwoSidedReserveFactor
public abstract class AbstractTwoSidedFactor<T>
extends AbstractFactor<T>

Abstract class for two-sided factors. The neighbors in two-sided factors can be grouped in two sets (A and B). This class keeps the number of elements in the first set and provides methods to access the sorted messages for each set.

Author:
Toni Penya-Alba

getSortedSetAPairs

protected List<NeighborValue<T>> getSortedSetAPairs()
Get a list of pairs for the factors in set A. The list is sorted by the value of the last message received.

Returns:
pair list A list of pairs for the factors in set A.

getSortedSetBPairs

protected List<NeighborValue<T>> getSortedSetBPairs()
Get a list of pairs for the factors in set B. The list is sorted by the value of the last message received.

Returns:
pair list B list of pairs for the factors in set B.

getReserve

protected int getReserve(Map<T,Boolean> values)
Get the difference between the number of active neighbors in set A and the number of active neighbors in set B. That is, |active(A)| - |active(B)|.

Parameters:
values - a map describing the active state of each neighbor.
Returns:
reserve the difference between the number of active neighbors in sets A and B.
